intro: Antirhea martini, commonly known as the mountain antirhea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
